entries.title: French nun Sister André, world's oldest person, dies at 118
entries.description: Lucile Randon, known as Sister André was born in 1904 – the year New York opened its first subway and when the Tour de France had only been staged once.

entries.title: For the Arctic, the war in Ukraine means a geopolitical reshuffle
entries.description: Russia holds the rotating chairmanship of the Arctic Council, putting many essential projects on hold due to its invasion of Ukraine.

entries.title: France braces for 'hellish Thursday' as pension strikes loom
entries.description: The industrial action across different sectors will be the first time in 12 years that all of France's unions are united.

entries.title: Brazil charges dozens in pro-Bolsonaro riots, with more expected
entries.description: Brazilian prosecutors said the January 8 rioters had been charged with armed criminal association and staging a coup, amongst other crimes.

entries.title: Europe heads to space as it unveils Arctic satellite launchpad
entries.description: To meet the expected increase of minisatellites being sent into space, about fifteen spaceports are currently under development in Europe.

entries.title: Greta Thunberg detained at German coal mine protest
entries.description: A police spokesperson said those detained had not been formally arrested.

entries.title: Key suspect in EU corruption scandal cuts deal with prosecutors
entries.description: The alleged ringleader of a European Union cash-for-influence corruption scandal linked to Qatar and Morocco has decided to reveal information about the affair in exchange for a lighter sentence, Belgian prosecutors said Tuesday.

entries.title: In Sweden, the discovery of a rare earth deposit raises concern among Indigenous populations
entries.description: Since mining company LKAB identified a deposit containing one million tons of rare earth oxides, Sami reindeer herders have been expressing their anger.

entries.title: 'The Chinese may not necessarily want to overthrow Xi Jinping'
entries.description: The end of the zero-Covid policy has caused a peak in the epidemic, but it marks above all the full-speed restart for the Chinese economy.

entries.title: Indonesia: Joko Widodo expresses 'regrets' about mass crimes
entries.description: Twelve 'serious human rights violations' were recognized by the president, including the massacres of 1965-1966, as well as killings, blunders and abuses by the army and police committed since democratization in 1998.

entries.title: Pressured by the far right, Brittany town abandons plan to welcome refugees
entries.description: The mayor of Callac wanted to welcome a handful of refugee families in the next 10 years to revitalize his declining small town.

entries.title: French government turns to conservatives and communists for support on nuclear power
entries.description: A bill to accelerate the construction of new nuclear reactors, which arrives in the Sénat on Tuesday, January 17, is expected to have the two opposition groups.

entries.title: China stopped driving global growth in 2022
entries.description: The GDP of the world's second-largest economy grew by just 3% last year, the worst figure on record since 1976, bar the 2020 Covid crisis.

entries.title: Former Wagner commander seeks asylum in Norway
entries.description: Andrey Medvedev, a former high-ranking member of the Wagner Group has been on the run since he defected from the paramilitary organization on July 6.

entries.title: Trial of ultraright terrorism plotters starts in Paris
entries.description: Thirteen individuals who had planned to attack Emmanuel Macron, migrants and mosques are being tried from Tuesday.

entries.title: David Carrick: Serial rapist sacked from London police force
entries.description: David Carrick, a former police officer, admitted 24 counts of rape against 12 women. He will be sentenced in court over two days from February 6.

entries.title: Nobel-winning Swiss physicist Muller dies at 95
entries.description: Muller was awarded for his and Georg Bednorz's discovery of the first high-temperature superconductor.

entries.title: 'The Last of Us': The girl, death and zombies
entries.description: This adaptation of a video game created by Naughty Dog finds its strength in the two stars, Pedro Pascal and Bella Ramsey, without renouncing its origins.

entries.title: Final death toll of Russian strike on Dnipro reaches 44
entries.description: The Russian missile strike on an apartment building on Saturday came as the war's deadliest attack since the spring on civilians at one location.

entries.title: At Davos, the end of globalization is on everyone's mind
entries.description: The US-China trade war and the race for subsidies are fueling global fragmentation, the central theme of the 53rd World Economic Forum in Switzerland.

entries.title: Former head of the Mexican police on trial for drug trafficking with the El Chapo cartel
entries.description: Genaro Garcia Luna's trial for cocaine trafficking is expected to reveal the relationship between drug traffickers and the Mexican government under President Felipe Calderon.

entries.title: French football boss Le Graët under investigation for sexual harassment
entries.description: Noël Le Graët, the president of the French Football Federation who was forced to step down pending an audit, is being investigated after accusations from a player agent.

entries.title: Nuclear power: France's race against time to build new reactors
entries.description: The bill to shorten administrative procedures to facilitate future construction is being examined in the Sénat, starting on Tuesday.

entries.title: Vietnam president resigns amid major anti-corruption purge
entries.description: Nguyen Xuan Phuc resigned after the ruling Communist Party blamed him for 'violations and wrongdoings' by officials under his control while prime minister, the government said on Tuesday.

entries.title: Germany set to appoint Boris Pistorius as new defense minister, according to reports
entries.description: Boris Pistorius, a relatively unknown politician who is currently interior minister for the state of Lower Saxony, will be Germany's new defense minister, German media reported.

entries.title: Arrest of Matteo Messina Denaro, last 'boss' of Sicilian mafia, closes long Italian history chapter
entries.description: A member of the Corleone clan, Matteo Messina Denaro, who helped organize the 1992 bombings against Italian prosecutors Giovanni Falcone and Paolo Borsellino, was arrested in a Palermo clinic on Monday, aged 60.

entries.title: Frene Ginwala, historical anti-apartheid activist, dies aged 90
entries.description: This Indian South African lawyer was chosen by Nelson Mandela to lead the first democratic Parliament of South Africa.

entries.title: War in Ukraine: TotalEnergies 'war crimes complicity' case dropped
entries.description: As revealed by 'Le Monde', TotalEnergies had a stake in a firm that refined natural gas into fuel used by Russian fighter jets. French prosecutors closed the case with no further action.

entries.title: In eastern DRC, homosexuals forced into hiding
entries.description: There is no law criminalizing homosexuality in the Democratic Republic of Congo, but harassment, attacks and hatred against the LGBTQ+  community are rampant.

entries.title: In France, tourism renews itself post-pandemic
entries.description: In 2022, the French tourism industry revealed preferences for more local and outdoor activities, while international travelers returned even as hotel prices sharply increased.

entries.title: The consequences of criticizing politicians on social media in northern Nigeria
entries.description: Intimidation, speedy trials, corporal punishment: Several young people have been prosecuted in this conservative part of the country.

entries.title: War in Ukraine: European governments announce delivery of first tanks to Kyiv
entries.description: After pledges from Finland and Poland, the United Kingdom announced on Saturday that it would deliver 14 Challenger 2 aircraft 'in the coming weeks.'

entries.title: France struggles to eradicate invasive species
entries.description: As regulations fall short, the influx of invasive alien species continues to increase and harm biodiversity.

entries.title: China's population shrinks for the first time in over six decades
entries.description: The nation of 1.4 billion has seen birth rates plunge to record lows as its workforce ages, in a rapid decline that analysts warn could stymie economic growth.

entries.title: French nuclear power: 'Accelerate the laws, the rallying cry has been issued'
entries.description: The French parliament is looking at two bills, one for nuclear power and the other for wind power, with a view to removing obstacles to the deployment of these energies.

entries.title: 40 countries call on Israel to lift sanctions imposed on Palestinians
entries.description: Earlier this month, Israel imposed sanctions because of the Palestinian Authority's push to get the UN's top court to issue an advisory opinion on the Israeli occupation.

entries.title: California storms persist but the end seems near
entries.description: On Monday, California Governor Gavin Newsom signed an executive order to further bolster the state’s emergency storm response.
